location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.349 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter, enclosing correspondence received by Kemball from Khojeh Hiskale, the Native Agent at Muscat, and dated 6 November 1853. The letters report on the liabilities of the Muscat authorities to the Wahhabi leader Abdullah ben Fysul [Abdullah bin Faisal]. 10,000 crowns having already been paid to the Wahhabi leader, the Imam of Muscat plans to extract a levy on all citizens in Muscat (Muslim and Hindu), in order to pay Abdullah bin Faisal the remaining 30,000 crowns due.
